content: for yarn sample used 5 5mm optional double_crochet double_crochet a large hook to help with the laddering up process i used an 2dc work 2 double_crochet stitches into one stitch 8mm quintr quintuple triple yo 6 times insert hook and pull up a loop yo pull through two loops until you total yardage 26 yards includes optional round are back to one loop on the hook slightly bigger coaster pattern r1 12dc join to turning chain with a slip_stitch r2 2dc 12 times join to turning chain with a slip_stitch r3 2sc single_crochet in next 3 sts 6 times join to turning chain with a slip_stitch r4 stitches in brackets are worked into the same 1quintr and 1dc 1dc and 1quintr 1dc stitch 1dc and 1quintr 2dc 1quintr 2dc 2dc 1quintr and 1dc 1dc 1quintr and 1dc 1dc ch10 cut yarn 1quintr and 1dc 1dc and 1quintr ladder up the quintr stitches starting with the first 1dc 1dc and 1quintr 2dc 1quintr 1dc one made be careful not to twist the quintrs 1dc and 1quintr 2dc 1quintr 2dc 1quintr and 1dc 1dc 1quintr and 1dc 1dc and 1quintr 1dc 1dc take ch10 and weave through the first ladder as so insert ch10 back to front in the previous ladder loop then around the base legs of the first ladder loop then front to back through previous loop then join with a slip_stitch to the same stitch as your last double_crochet if you don t do r5 while weaving in your outside end sew the base of the ch10 to the top of your turning chain picture tutorial below r5 optional start away from where your other rounds started 2sc 1sc in next 7 sts 6 times when you get to where r4 was supposed to be joined just crochet normally following the pattern do a single_crochet or 2sc in the base of the ch10 and do the next into your turning chain for the previous round join to turning chain with a slip_stitch picture tutorial below tutorials what to do with the ch10 insert ch10 back to front in the previous ladder loop then around the base legs of the first ladder loop then front to back through previous loop then join with a slip_stitch to the same stitch as your last double_crochet slip_stitch complete if not adding the optional round here is how to finish turn your coaster over you ll see how the last stitches have a gap if you aren t doing the optional round tie this gap together using your ends before weaving them in if you are doing the optional round you don t need to sew the sides together use your needle to work one of the ends up to the top of your turning chain then poke it back to front through the top of the turning chain and then front to back through the base outside edge of your ch10 repeat the back to front front to back motion and tighten tie
